qas.question: What was the light gun controller called?
What was the name of the auxiliary port used to connect additional devices on the Famicom?
How were the special controllers connected to the NES?
What was the dark gun controller called?
What was the name of the auxiliary port used to not connect additional devices on the Famicom?

plausible_answers.text: two control ports on the front of the console

qas.question: How were the special controllers disconnected to the NES?

context: A number of special controllers designed for use with specific games were released for the system, though very few such devices proved particularly popular. Such devices included, but were not limited to, the <a0_0><b3_0>Zapper<b3_0/><a0_0/> (a light gun), the R.O.B., and the Power Pad. The original Famicom featured a deepened <a1_0><b4_0>DA-15<b4_0/><a1_0/> expansion port on the front of the unit, which was used to connect most auxiliary devices. On the NES, these special controllers were generally connected to one of the <b5_0>two <a2_0>control ports on the front<a2_0/> of the console<b5_0/>.
